author: Special Correspondent
text:
A truck terminal, constructed at a cost of Rs. 6 crore near the omni bus stand in Mattuthavani, was ready for use, said Mayor V.V. Rajan Chellappa here on Thursday.

After inspecting the terminal, he told reporters that with the shifting of the truck terminal to Mattuthavani, traffic congestion would be avoided in the heart of the city.

About 125 lorries can be parked at the terminal which has restrooms for the crew, toilets, a workshop where small repairs can be carried out and office space for officials in the rank of assistant engineers to monitor the activities.

A senior official said that Chief Minister Jayalalithaa would dedicate the new facility for public use shortly through video conferencing.

Raid conducted

In a surprise raid, a team of officials led by City Health Officer Yasoda Mani raided shops and establishments which were using banned plastic articles of less than 40 microns. During the raid, which was conducted under the direction of Deputy Commissioner S. Shanti, 110 kg of banned plastic goods were seized and fines to the tune of Rs. 46,600 slapped on erring shops and establishments.
title: Truck terminal ready
